course_title: Special Topics In Economics: Health Economics
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 28 / Seats Avail: 22Waitlist Total: 0 of 6
class_notes:
Synchronous class attendance required; timed, asynchronous assessments. You must have completed ECON/ECON_OX 101 (or equivalent) and have either completed ECON/ECON_OX 201 or be concurrently enrolled in it (or receive permission from the instructor).


In this class, we will apply economic principles and tools to study the healthcare market by looking at the structure, cost, and distribution of resources within the healthcare sector. Topics will include the socioeconomic determinants of health, demand and supply of health insurance, hospital competition, physician practice, government intervention in the health-care market, and comparisons of health-systems around the world.
course_description: Course may be repeated for credit when topic varies. Seminar and/or advanced course in selected topics in economics.
sections: Class Nbr: 3562, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: OXF, Meets: MW 4-5:15p, Instructor: D. Ludwinski, Status: Open
